<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Lucky Number](/Spells.aspx?ID=941)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Contingency" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=385" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 113 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 10 minutes ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the next time you make your daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

When you Cast this Spell, roll 1d20 and make a note of the result. You gain the following reaction; once you use the reaction, the spell ends, and you become temporarily immune to _lucky number_ until the next time you make your daily preparations.

 **That's My Number!** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76)) **Trigger** You roll your lucky number as your d20 result on a non-[secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) attack roll, saving throw, or skill check; **Effect** You call upon the fortune stored within your lucky number and reroll the triggering check. However, pushing your luck has a price: if your result on the reroll is the same number again, you critically fail, regardless of what degree of success you ordinarily would have received.
